column4: how can i check in which repository in /etc/apt/sources.list apt-get found a package?
do apt-cache show package, it will tell you the repo it is in
it's not showing me...
what is the package?
for example, kdict

when you do apt-cache search kdict, look for this line "Section: universe/net" and this line "Filename: pool/universe/k/kdenetwork/kdict_3.5.5-0ubuntu1_i386.deb" from those I determine that it is in the universe repo
but which entry in sources.list is it? many repositories just have "main"
the most reliable one is the second line right after pool/ there will be main universe restricted or whatever it is
well there is a main repo
it would be the line that says something like deb http://archive.ubuntu.com edgy main
kubuntu doesn't have its own repository, maybe you have some kde repositories but that is different
pastebin your /etc/apt/sources.list, that should make it a bit easier to see exactly
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/39125/
so is mine, but I switched over to xubuntu this time so I figured that was an xubuntu only thing
seems right
they can read and execute it but they can't write to it
you can set it up that way if you wish, or perhaps put the files you don't want other to see in a specific directory and make that unaccessible to others
really doesn't matter between the two
you could set up a cron job to try periodically
it should have, do which java
that is not normal, you can either add that thing you put up above to the path or symlink it so it is in the path
